Minimal Pair: Is raining. → It is raining.
Label: [Prescriptive]
Justification: C1s know dummy 'it' is required but omit in chat. Self-evident fix.

Minimal Pair: Is very difficult. → It is very difficult.
Label: [Prescriptive]
Justification: Same as above; code-switching in casual contexts.

Minimal Pair: Don't know what to do. → I don't know what to do.
Label: [Prescriptive]
Justification: Very common in WhatsApp/chat. Self-evident once flagged.

Minimal Pair: My brother he is tall. → My brother is tall.
Label: [Naturalness]
Justification: Acceptable emphasis in speech; annoying in formal writing. Simple deletion.
Cantonese Source: 我阿哥佢好高 (topic + comment structure)

Minimal Pair: The report doesn't show... → The report does not show...
Label: [Descriptive]
Justification: C1s know when to expand. Flagging in business emails is annoying; most companies accept contractions.

Minimal Pair: It was write → It was written
Label: [Prescriptive]
Justification: Basic morphology; C1 knows past participle.

Minimal Pair: Interested in to learn → Interested in learning
Label: [Prescriptive]
Justification: Preposition + gerund rule is basic; self-evident.

Minimal Pair: Much people → Many people
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: Many money → Much money
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: More better → Better
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: Taller from me → Taller than me
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: The most good → The best
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: The students books → The students' books
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: Its raining → It's raining
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: That book is my → That book is mine
Label: [Prescriptive]
Cantonese Source: 嗰本書係我嘅 (single form 我嘅)

Minimal Pair: The Hong Kong is busy. → Hong Kong is busy.
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: Three book → Three books
Label: [Prescriptive]
Justification: Very basic for C1; self-evident with numeral.

Minimal Pair: Two childs → Two children
Label: [Prescriptive]
Justification: Basic morphology; C1 knows irregular forms.

Minimal Pair: She work here. → She works here.
Label: [Prescriptive]
Justification: Very common slip; self-evident for C1.

Minimal Pair: Will can you help? → Can you help?
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: You should to go. → You should go.
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: In Monday → On Monday
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: Depend of → Depend on
Label: [Prescriptive]
Justification: Fixed collocation; C1 knows once flagged.

Minimal Pair: Listen the music → Listen to the music
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: Discuss about → Discuss
Label: [Prescriptive]

Minimal Pair: The place who I visited → The place that I visited
Label: [Prescriptive]
Justification: Simple substitution; C1 knows 'who' is for people.
Cantonese Source: 我去過嗰度 (single 嗰 for all)
